creditline: The Winton Jones Endowment Fund for Prints and Drawings
description: man with curly hair and beard, looking at a book held in his PL hand, holding a staff with a spear tip in his PR hand; cliff behind man with sea over his PL shoulder, birds flying over water; text at bottom:  "VII. / INDE VENTURUS EST, IVDICA- / RE VIVOS & MORTUOS."
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

LLC of the sheet, printed: [8.]; center, below image: [VII.]; verso, at top edge, in light brown: [1115]
portfolio: From Christ, the Twelve Apostles, and Saint Paul
provenance: Baroness Emma Louise Rothschild, England (until d. 1935; part of an extra illustrated Bible compiled between 1815 and 1848); by descent to the Hon. Miranda Rothschild, England (until 2001; sale, Bloomsbury Book Auctions, London, May 31, 2001, no. 111, in vol. 12 of 14 in compiled Bible, for Â£16,100, to Frederick Mulder); [Frederick Mulder, London, from 2001]. [Jan Johnson Old Master and Modern Prints, Inc., Quebec, by 2011-2012; sold to MIA]
signed: LLC of the image, in the print: [HG fecit]
title: Saint Thomas, Plate 8 from the series Christ, the Twelve Apostles, and Saint Paul
